SENT.plain: Berberine is an alkaloid derived from herb medicine Coptidis Rhizom
Although there are increasing evidences that berberine exhibits neuroprotective effects against ischemic brain damage, little is known about the mechanism
In this study, we investigated the effect of berberine on ischemic injury in a middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO) model
We found that berberine improved neurological outcome and reduced ischemia/reperfusion (I/R)-induced cerebral infarction 48h after MCAO
The protective effect of berberine was confirmed in in vitro study
Berberine protected PC12 cells against oxygen-glucose deprivation (OGD)-induced injury
The results showed that berberine inhibited reactive oxygen species (ROS) generation, and subsequent release of pro-apoptotic factor cytochrome c and apoptosis-inducing factors (AIFs) evoked by OGD
Findings of this study suggest that berberine protects against ischemic brain injury by decreasing the intracellular ROS level and subsequently inhibiting mitochondrial apoptotic pathway
